description.zh-cn: 明朝后期将领，镇守辽东三十年，官至辽东总兵、太傅，封宁远伯。其对女真采取的政策深刻影响了后金的崛起。
description.en: A general in the late Ming Dynasty who guarded Liaodong for thirty years, holding positions such as Liaodong Commander-in-chief and Grand Tutor, and was ennobled as Earl of Ningyuan. His policies towards the Jurchens significantly influenced the rise of the Later Jin.

description.zh-cn: 建州女真首领，后金建立者。其父塔克世在李成梁的军事行动中被杀。
description.en: A Jurchen chieftain of the Jianzhou Jurchens and the founder of the Later Jin dynasty. His father, Taksi, was killed during a military campaign led by Li Chengliang.

description.zh-cn: 努尔哈赤的父亲，建州女真首领之一，在李成梁攻打阿台的战斗中身亡。
description.en: Father of Nurhaci and a Jianzhou Jurchen leader, who died during Li Chengliang's attack on Atai's fortress.

description.zh-cn: 明朝末年建州女真首领，后被李成梁击败并处死。
description.en: A Jianzhou Jurchen leader in the late Ming Dynasty, who was defeated and executed by Li Chengliang.

description.zh-cn: 王杲之子，为反抗明朝与其作战，后在李成梁的进攻中身亡。
description.en: Son of Wang Gao, he fought against the Ming dynasty and was killed during an attack led by Li Chengliang.

description.zh-cn: 内喀尔喀蒙古首领，曾多次与李成梁作战，后被李成梁部将击杀。
description.en: A leader of the Inner Khalkha Mongols who repeatedly fought against Li Chengliang and was eventually killed by Li's subordinate.

description.zh-cn: 叶赫部首领，后被李成梁设计斩杀。
description.en: A leader of the Yehe tribe, who was later killed in a plot by Li Chengliang.

description.zh-cn: 叶赫部首领，与清佳努一同被李成梁设计斩杀。
description.en: A leader of the Yehe tribe, killed alongside Qingjianu in a plot by Li Chengliang.

description.zh-cn: 明朝万历年间内阁首辅，曾力荐李成梁复起镇守辽东。
description.en: Grand Secretary of the Ming Dynasty during the Wanli era, who strongly recommended Li Chengliang's reappointment to guard Liaodong.

description.zh-cn: 明朝末期将领，曾接手辽东防务，并严厉批评李成梁晚年的政策。
description.en: A general in the late Ming Dynasty who took over the defense of Liaodong and severely criticized Li Chengliang's policies in his later years.

description.zh-cn: 明朝官员，曾弹劾李成梁对努尔哈赤的姑息政策。
description.en: A Ming Dynasty official who impeached Li Chengliang for his policy of appeasement towards Nurhaci.

description.zh-cn: 明朝万历前期的内阁首辅，著名改革家。曾对李成梁杀降冒功的行为有所偏袒。
description.en: Grand Secretary during the early Wanli era of the Ming Dynasty and a famous reformer. He showed favoritism towards Li Chengliang regarding his misconduct of killing surrendered enemies to claim merits.

description.zh-cn: 李成梁长子，明朝著名将领。
description.en: Eldest son of Li Chengliang and a famous general of the Ming Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 李成梁之父，世袭铁岭卫指挥佥事。
description.en: Father of Li Chengliang, who held the hereditary title of Commander of Tieling Guard.

description.zh-cn: 明朝扶植的建州女真首领，据称与李成梁合谋导致塔克世之死。
description.en: A Jianzhou Jurchen leader supported by the Ming Dynasty, allegedly conspired with Li Chengliang, leading to the death of Taksi.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上的一个朝代，李成梁为其效力的政权。
description.en: A dynasty in Chinese history, the regime for which Li Chengliang served.

description.zh-cn: 明朝在辽东地区的最高军事长官职位，李成梁曾长期担任此职。
description.en: The highest military commander position in the Liaodong region during the Ming Dynasty, a post Li Chengliang held for a long time.

description.zh-cn: 由李成梁组织和指挥的精锐骑兵部队，威震边疆。
description.en: An elite cavalry unit organized and commanded by Li Chengliang, renowned for its power on the frontier.

description.zh-cn: 由努尔哈赤建立的政权，清朝的前身。
description.en: The regime established by Nurhaci, which was the predecessor of the Qing Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 努尔哈赤在起兵反明时颁布的檄文，其中包含为父祖报仇的理由。
description.en: A manifesto issued by Nurhaci when he rebelled against the Ming, which included the reason of avenging his father and grandfather.

description.zh-cn: 李成梁出生于辽宁铁岭。
description.en: Li Chengliang was born in Tieling, Liaoning.

description.zh-cn: 李成梁是明朝后期的重要将领。
description.en: Li Chengliang was an important general in the late Ming Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 李成梁前后两次担任辽东总兵，共计三十年。
description.en: Li Chengliang served as the Commander-in-chief of Liaodong for two separate terms, totaling thirty years.

description.zh-cn: 李成梁在镇守辽东期间组织了著名的辽东铁骑。
description.en: Li Chengliang organized the famous Liaodong Iron Cavalry while guarding Liaodong.

description.zh-cn: 1574年，李成梁督兵进剿王杲所在的古勒寨，最终王杲被捕并被处死。
description.en: In 1574, Li Chengliang led troops to attack Gure Fortress where Wang Gao was located, leading to Wang Gao's capture and execution.

description.zh-cn: 1583年2月，李成梁再度发兵攻打阿台所在的古勒寨，阿台中箭身亡。
description.en: In February 1583, Li Chengliang once again attacked Gure Fortress where Atai was located, and Atai was killed by an arrow.

description.zh-cn: 努尔哈赤之父塔克世在李成梁1583年进攻阿台的战斗中身亡，据称此为李成梁与尼堪外兰故意为之。
description.en: Nurhaci's father, Taksi, was killed during Li Chengliang's attack on Atai in 1583. It is alleged that this was an intentional act by Li Chengliang and Nikan Wailan.

description.zh-cn: 1582年3月，李成梁派遣部将在镇夷堡击杀蒙古首领速把亥。
description.en: In March 1582, Li Chengliang dispatched his subordinate to kill the Mongol leader Subohai at Zhenyi Fortress.

description.zh-cn: 1583年12月，李成梁与巡抚李松合谋斩杀叶赫部首领清佳努。
description.en: In December 1583, Li Chengliang conspired with Governor Li Song to kill Qingjianu, a leader of the Yehe tribe.

description.zh-cn: 1583年12月，李成梁与巡抚李松合谋斩杀叶赫部首领杨吉努。
description.en: In December 1583, Li Chengliang conspired with Governor Li Song to kill Yangjinu, a leader of the Yehe tribe.

description.zh-cn: 因父亲塔克世在李成梁的战斗中被杀，努尔哈赤视李成梁为不共戴天之仇，此事成为后金叛明“七大恨”之一。
description.en: Due to his father Taksi's death in a battle involving Li Chengliang, Nurhaci considered Li an irreconcilable enemy. This incident became one of the 'Seven Great Grievances' for the Later Jin's rebellion against the Ming.

description.zh-cn: 李成梁在杀死努尔哈赤之父后，对其进行补偿，并在晚年采取姑息纵容政策，对其“保奏给官”、“弃地以饵之”，客观上助长了建州女真势力的崛起。
description.en: After killing Nurhaci's father, Li Chengliang compensated him and later adopted a policy of appeasement, recommending him for official positions and ceding territory to him, which objectively facilitated the rise of the Jianzhou Jurchen power.

description.zh-cn: 努尔哈赤统一女真各部后，于1616年建立后金政权。
description.en: After unifying the Jurchen tribes, Nurhaci established the Later Jin regime in 1616.

description.zh-cn: 努尔哈赤于1618年以“七大恨”为由，正式对明朝宣战。
description.en: In 1618, Nurhaci formally declared war on the Ming Dynasty, citing the 'Seven Great Grievances'.

description.zh-cn: “七大恨”的发布标志着后金与明朝的公开决裂和战争的开始。
description.en: The proclamation of the 'Seven Great Grievances' marked the open break and the beginning of the war between the Later Jin and the Ming Dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 1601年，大学士沈一贯力荐已被罢官的李成梁复起，再镇辽东。
description.en: In 1601, Grand Secretary Shen Yiguan strongly recommended the dismissed Li Chengliang to be reappointed to guard Liaodong.

description.zh-cn: 熊廷弼在接手辽东防务后，严厉批评李成梁晚年的弃地等政策，并上疏弹劾，指出其罪可至死。
description.en: After taking over the defense of Liaodong, Xiong Tingbi severely criticized Li Chengliang's late-career policies, such as abandoning territory, and impeached him, stating his crimes were punishable by death.

description.zh-cn: 宋一韩等廷臣曾弹劾李成梁对努尔哈赤的姑息政策。
description.en: Court officials like Song Yihan impeached Li Chengliang for his policy of appeasement towards Nurhaci.

description.zh-cn: 1578年李成梁部下发生杀降冒功事件，时任首辅的张居正虽知有隐情，但仍对李成梁有所偏袒。
description.en: In 1578, when Li Chengliang's troops killed surrendered enemies to claim merits, Grand Secretary Zhang Juzheng, despite knowing the truth, showed favoritism towards Li.
